intro: Epidendrum zipaquiranum, commonly known as the Zipaquirá orchid, is a species of orchid native to Colombia. It is characterized by its striking violet and white floral display, which makes it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its flowers are relatively short-lived but produce a profusion of blooms during the growing season. Epidendrum zipaquiranum requires bright, indirect light and consistent humidity to thrive.
